text: the details of what's happening tonight
in Turkey are unclear
the pictures are unverified but there's
little doubt there's a big military
presence on the streets of the country's
two main cities in a statement turkey's
armed forces said they had taken power
to protect democratic order and maintain
human rights they said the rule of law
would be protected the media in Turkey
is heavily controlled by the state but
pictures have emerged on social media of
unusual military activity in Istanbul on
the bridges across the Bosporus
roadblocks were set up stopping some
traffic moving from the Asian to the
European side and in the night sky over
the capital Ankara a low-flying military
jet gunshots were also reported the
Turkish Prime Minister Banali yildirim
who had earlier been speaking of his
support for France said this evening
that some members of the military had
been acting outside the chain of command
he said those taking any illegal action
would pay the highest price nothing has
been heard so far from the turkish
President Tayyip Erdogan seen here
recently at a NATO summit in Warsaw he's
reported to be on holiday in the Turkish
coastal resort of bhadram Turkey has
been hit recently by a string of bomb
attacks in Ankara and Istanbul Islamic
extremists were said to be to blame the
government has responded by cracking
down on any opposition Turkey is in a
state of crisis tonight all flights from
Istanbul Ataturk Airport have been
canceled there are severe restrictions
on the internet with many types of
social media shut down
